title: Panic involving fork cheatcode when doing weird reentrancy
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (87283bc 2023-10-06T00:32:37.923803000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

Running `forge test` with the following solidity code causes a panic:
```solidity
// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.13;

import "forge-std/Test.sol";

contract ForkingTest is Test {
    uint256 mainnetFork;
    uint256 optimismFork;

    function setUp() public {
        mainnetFork = vm.createFork("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/ALCHEMY_KEY");
        optimismFork = vm.createFork("https://opt-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/ALCHEMY_KEY");
    }   

    function testForking() public {
        vm.selectFork(mainnetFork);
        Foo f = new Foo();
        f.doCallback();
    }   

    function switchFork() public {
        vm.selectFork(optimismFork);
    }   
}

contract Foo {
    uint256 public n;
    constructor() {
        n = 0;
    }   
    function setN(uint256 m) public {
        n = m;
    }   
    function doCallback() public {
        ForkingTest c = ForkingTest(msg.sender);
        c.switchFork();
        setN(1); // Causes a rust panic. I think the panic is because this contract doesn't exist in the optimism fork
    }   
}
```

need to check but the circular call pattern likely messes something up

this isn't very trivial to fix unfortunately because we don't have easy access to the `Foo` contract inside the `vm.selectFork(optimismFork);` call and can't easily autodetect this and prevent a panic...

and you're correct the panic is because the contract does not exist, you can fix this by marking the sender as persistent inside the switchFork: `vm.makePersistent(msg.sender);`
Makes sense. I'm not relying on this working or anything, I was just playing around with fork cheatcode edge cases and stumbled upon this one, figured I'd report it since it caused a panic.
